page.title: 03Landscape of the Area
page.content: This small corner of Northumberland is a most attractive piece of country. The land here consists of rolling country with a large wood of mixed trees and part of a larger forest of conifers. The land is grassland used for grazing cattle and sheep, very little of it is flat. The area is traversed in a roughly north - south direction by two streams (known in this county as burns), the Coe Burn and the Edlingham Burn; both of which join the River Aln about 1 km to the north of the area. There are just two roads, again north - south in direction. One of these in the west of the area, is the main road from Newcastle via Morpeth and Wooler to Coldstream and Edinburgh (A697). The other is a tiny country road from Edlingham to the village of Bolton.
